You have taken by far the best band in the world with biggest fan base and destroyed every fans joy in waiting for the release date and thrown it out of the window because we(the fans) are going to be exposed to this even if we dont download it. You Sidcookie has destroyed an album by trying to distribute before hand and depriving millions of others by taking away their joy of opening the cd cases on the due date or at least only being able to pirate it 24 hours after release. I think you are a selfish asshole and should go bury yourself in a ocean of shit. I as respected sound engineer despise things like this!
@Zone09 wow... looks like someone is overreacting...

@Zone09 Most fans don't rely so heavily on the sentimental aspect of an album's release. It's pretty easy to avoid exposure to this album being leaked anyway. Just don't go on piratebay, wait a few more days for the official release, and buy your copy however you want.
@Zone09 I created an account just to say this to you. You sir make some good points. May I offer a rebuttal? Go fuck yourself with a cactus. The fuck are you doing on a torrenting site then?

Zone09,
I respect your views. I really do. I mean, as a sound engineer, you must see something that I don't.But please, you're on a torrent site. 90% or more of the people who come here don't find a POINT in paying for software, or music, or videos unless they're good. I know some people who torrent video games, then if they like it, they buy it. Its the same for music. A bunch of people grabbed it early. Maybe 90% of the users wont buy it again, but the remaining 10% will. The remaining 90%, including me, would have gotten it once its released anyway. Not everybody's rich enough to afford paying for music albums whenever they want to.

@Zone09, you are either:
A.) Yet another MPAA hire, diligently doing your job of protecting a dying business.
B.) A troll, and should fuck yourself. If you are, I'm sure you do frequently.
C.) Genuinely in love with the act of opening a CD, and therefore stupid. Seriously, man/woman/dude/chatbot, I haven't opened a CD since 1999 or so. 

Also, @Zone09. Linkin Park has sucked for years, and I only downloaded this because of your comment.  I don't know that I'll even listen to it, but I KNOW I wouldn't ever pick it up to buy at a store. I know I'm not the only person thinking that.

The music industry needs to realize their days of "play a song on the radio and people will overpay for an album" are over. It's that simple. People want good music and are not willing to put up with bullshit. That includes "respected sound engineers" whose greatest pleasure in life revolves around unwrapping plastic on the day that a studio designated.
